Crosby-Ironton Transportation, Inc.
August 10 at 6:09 PM ·

Since the Safe Learning Plan was released and decisions from the Crosby School board on August 6th for in person for all elementary, hybrid for secondary students. We are preparing School Bus Routes for for a 50% capacity restriction. (which means 38 students on a 77 passenger bus) Due to the plan set forth by MDE, we will no longer have the flexibility to provide multiple pickup and drop off locations.

We will ONLY be able to provide student(s) one pickup/drop off location.
Example: Home AM /Home PM, Daycare AM / Daycare PM, Mom's AM / Mom's PM, Dad's AM / Dad's PM
We believe we will be able to accommodate split custody along with routing that does not require a change in bus route.

Please understand we are looking to provide consistent transportation to as many students as possible and would like your students to ride on all scheduled days, which allows us to keep buses at their 50% capacity.

We want you to be aware of this transportation change to allow you time to make a decision that works best for your family.

Contact our Office ASAP with your decision. 218-546-6156

Josh

August 7 at 7:38 PM ·

The learning plan for the Crosby-Ironton School District this fall is as follows:

1. In person learning for all elementary students Monday through Thursday.

2. Hybrid model for students in grades 7-12.

3. Fridays are reserved for distance learning and deep cleaning.

Students in grades 7-12 can expect to be notified which cohort they have been assigned sometime within the next few weeks. We are trying to get that information out to students and families as soon as possible.

Cohort A for grades 7-12 will attend school on Mondays and Wednesdays.
Cohort B for grades 7-12 will attend school on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

If families intend to do distance learning only, please notify the school district as soon as possible.
